hw3

Class Cell

  • java.lang.Object
    • hw3.Cell

  • public class Cell
extends java.lang.Object

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Cell(boolean alive, int[] b, int[] s)
      Constructs a new cell in a Game of Life

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      int[] getBornRule()
      Returns the survive rule of the cell encoded in an array.
      int getNumAliveNeighbors()
      Gets the number of neighbors which are alive.
      int getNumNeighbors()
      Gets the neighbors of the cell.
      int[] getSurviveRule()
      Returns the survive rule of the cell encoded in an array.
      boolean isAlive()
      Returns the boolean value of whether the cell is dead or alive.
      boolean isAliveAfterNextGeneration()
      Returns the boolean value of whether the cell is dead or alive in the next generation.
      void nextGeneration()
      Sets the current status of the cell equal to the status of the cell after one generation of the game.
      void setIsAliveNextGeneration()
      Sets the status of the cell (dead or alive) in the next generation.
      void setNeighbors(java.util.ArrayList<Cell> n)
      Sets the neighbors of the cell.
      java.lang.String toString()
      Returns a String representation of the cell.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Cell

        public Cell(boolean alive,
            int[] b,
            int[] s)
        Constructs a new cell in a Game of Life
        Parameters:
        alive - the initial state of the cell
        b - an array of integers encoding the born rules for the cell
        s - an array of integers encoding the survive rules for the cell

    • Method Detail

      • isAlive

        public boolean isAlive()
        Returns the boolean value of whether the cell is dead or alive.
        Returns:
        the boolean value of whether the cell is dead or alive.

      • isAliveAfterNextGeneration

        public boolean isAliveAfterNextGeneration()
        Returns the boolean value of whether the cell is dead or alive in the next generation.
        Returns:
        the boolean value of whether the cell is dead or alive in the next generation.

      • setIsAliveNextGeneration

        public void setIsAliveNextGeneration()
        Sets the status of the cell (dead or alive) in the next generation. The status is determined by the born and alive rules.

      • setNeighbors

        public void setNeighbors(java.util.ArrayList<Cell> n)
        Sets the neighbors of the cell. Note that the cell is not neighbors with itself.
        Parameters:
        ArrayList - of Cells of the neighboring cells.

      • getNumNeighbors

        public int getNumNeighbors()
        Gets the neighbors of the cell. Note that the cell is not neighbors with itself.
        Returns:
        number of the neighboring cells.

      • getNumAliveNeighbors

        public int getNumAliveNeighbors()
        Gets the number of neighbors which are alive.
        Returns:
        number of neighboring cells which are alive

      • nextGeneration

        public void nextGeneration()
        Sets the current status of the cell equal to the status of the cell after one generation of the game.

      • getBornRule

        public int[] getBornRule()
        Returns the survive rule of the cell encoded in an array.
        Returns:
        a copy of the born rule this cell is initialized with.

      • getSurviveRule

        public int[] getSurviveRule()
        Returns the survive rule of the cell encoded in an array.
        Returns:
        a copy of the survive rule this cell is initialized with.

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Returns a String representation of the cell. Returns "0" if the cell is dead or "1" if the cell is alive.
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        a string representing the current state of the cell.
